snippet: After Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan urged the church to reach out to gay men and lesbians, a Long Island man said he had been relieved of his parish duties because he wed his boyfriend.
abstract: Nicholas Coppola, longtime active member of St Anthony's Roman Catholic Church in Oceanside, LI, says he was ousted from his parish duties by Diocese of Rockville Centre after he legally wed his boyfriend; revelation comes days after Cardinal Timothy M Dolan said the Roman Catholic Church should do a better job of reaching out to gay men and lesbians.
lead_paragraph: After Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan urged the church to reach out to gay men and lesbians, a Long Island man said he had been relieved of his parish duties because he wed his boyfriend.

headline.seo: Long Island Man Says Catholic Church Rebuffed Him After Gay Marriage
headline.main: Gay Man Says Catholic Parish Rebuffed Him After Marriage
headline.print_headline: Gay Man Says Catholic Parish Rebuffed Him After Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
